detaileddescription.para:
This helps to declare and identify inline static functions for the LIN Integration component
Value: static inline

This helps to declare and identify static functions for the LIN Integration component
Value: static
This is the schedule time for LIN

The schedule time is 10 ms and is dependent on time base of the LIN timer.
value: 2 (10ms/K_LIN_CYCLE_TIME)
This defines the type for the Schedule tables data used by Lin Integration component
Array that contains the schedule tables data for all LIN interfaces

memberdef.argsstring: (const l_ifc_handle ifc, const uint8 nextScheduledEntry, const l_schedule_handle requestedSchedule)
memberdef.name: LinScheduleApplUpdate

briefdescription.para: This function handles switching of schedule table for LIN bus while applicative schedule is activated.

detaileddescription.para: This function will be called from LinInt_ScheduleTable_Update() While in applicative schedule it can be changed to flash, diagnostic or another applicative.

simplesect.para: reentrant: No context: LinTask thread safe: No - Integration must insure that the function is not interrupted by the other functions of the same module multicore safe: No - All APIs needs to be called from the same core synchronous

parameterdescription.para: - LIN interface

simplesect.title: Input->Output-Correlation
simplesect.para: If the context of LinInt_ScheduleTable_Update(), if the activated schedule is application schedule the current function will be called to handle the actual switching of the schedule table for the provided LIN interface

simplesect.title: Test Method
simplesect.para: The testing method is described on TEST_LinScheduleApplUpdate

simplesect.title: Traceability
simplesect.para: {SWR_ICAS1_L3_DK4_274, SWR_ICAS1_L3_DK4_276, SWR_ICAS1_L3_DK4_278, SWR_ICAS1_L3_DK4_281, SWR_ICAS1_L3_DK4_630} Design Decision - Justification. This is a helper function to handle the switching of schedule table for LIN bus while applicative schedule is activated.

memberdef.argsstring: (const l_ifc_handle ifc, const uint8 nextScheduledEntry, const scheduleType requestedScheduleType, const scheduleType activatedScheduleType)
memberdef.name: LinScheduleDiagnosis

briefdescription.para: This function performs diagnostic actions for LIN Schedule for specific LIN bus,.

detaileddescription.para: The function will update istverbau status for LIN slaves, resets flag that suspends LIN communication DTCs and shortens time between schedule switch for slave response.

simplesect.para: reentrant: No context: LinTask thread safe: No - Integration must insure that the function is not interrupted by the other functions of the same module multicore safe: No - All APIs needs to be called from the same core synchronous

parameterdescription.para: - LIN interface

simplesect.title: Input->Output-Correlation
simplesect.para: Will be called in the context of LinInt_ScheduleTable_Update(), before switching the schedule table. The flag that suspends LIN communication DTCs will be reset if nextScheduledEntry parameter is 1. If the activated schedule type is application schedule or alternative schedule, the presence status of the LIN bus will be reset by calling BIL_IstverbauReset() function.

simplesect.title: Test Method
simplesect.para: The testing method is described on TEST_LinScheduleDiagnosis

simplesect.title: Traceability
simplesect.para: Design Decision - Justification. This function will perform diagnostic actions for LIN Schedule for a provided LIN bus.

briefdescription.para: Inline function to return the index for the LIN bus based on the provided ifc.

simplesect.para: reentrant: Yes context: any task thread safe: Yes - - output based only on constants and parameters multicore safe: Yes - output based only on constants and parameters synchronous

parameterdescription.para: - LIN interface for which the index is requested

simplesect.para: uint8 - LIN index corresponding to the provided interface

simplesect.title: Call Sequence
simplesect.para: This helper function assumes that LIN_IFC_NR_MAX == LIN_CHANNELS_COUNT For this reason the function will return the provided parameter linInterface.

simplesect.title: Traceability
simplesect.para: Design Decision - Justification. Helper function to return the index for the LIN bus based on the provided LIN interface.

briefdescription.para: This function will check if the flashing table is activated for a LIN interface.

briefdescription.para: This function will request the alternative schedule table for a LIN interface.

simplesect.para: For DWA LIN: DWA sounder is coded and the driver door is locked.
If alternative schedule table is requested it should be released using the LinInt_ScheduleTable_ReleaseAlternative() interface.

briefdescription.para: This function will restore the previous requested table for the LIN interface.

detaileddescription.para: Used after a temporary switch to another LIN table.

simplesect.para: Should be called after a request to LinInt_ScheduleTable_SaveOldTable

reentrant: No context: DiagTask thread safe: No - Integration must insure that the function is not interrupted by the other functions of the same module multicore safe: No - All APIs needs to be called from the same core synchronous

parameterdescription.para: - interface for which the restore is requested

simplesect.title: Test Method
simplesect.para: The testing method is described on TEST_LinInt_ScheduleTable_RequestOldTable.

simplesect.title: Traceability
simplesect.para: Design Decision - Justification. Helper function to restore the previous requested table for a provided LIN interface.

briefdescription.para: This function will temporary save the current requested table for the LIN interface, so that it can be restored later.

detaileddescription.para: Used before a temporary switch to another LIN table.

simplesect.para: reentrant: No context: DiagTask thread safe: No - Integration must insure that the function is not interrupted by the other functions of the same module multicore safe: No - All APIs needs to be called from the same core synchronous
Should be called before a request to switch to a LIN diagnose schedule table

parameterdescription.para: - interface for which the save is requested

simplesect.title: Test Method
simplesect.para: The testing method is described on TEST_LinInt_ScheduleTable_SaveOldTable.

simplesect.title: Traceability
simplesect.para: Design Decision - Justification. Helper function to temporary save the current requested table for a provided LIN interface.

briefdescription.para: This function will temporary request another table for a LIN interface.

simplesect.para: There should be a request to switch to a LIN diagnose schedule table. LinInt_ScheduleTable_SaveOldTable() was used before to save the current requested table

reentrant: No context: DiagTask thread safe: No - Integration must insure that the function is not interrupted by the other functions of the same module multicore safe: No - All APIs needs to be called from the same core synchronous

parameterdescription.para: - interface for which the switch is requested
- Schedule table to be used for switch

simplesect.title: Test Method
simplesect.para: The testing method is described on TEST_LinInt_ScheduleTable_RequestTable.

simplesect.title: Traceability
simplesect.para: Design Decision - Justification. Helper function to temporary request another table for a provided LIN interface.

briefdescription.para: This function will get the requested schedule table for the LIN interface.

detaileddescription.para: For DWA LIN the result should be the main table if the Sounder is not armed, alternative table if the Sounder is armed or one of the diagnostics table

simplesect.para: reentrant: No context: any task thread safe: Yes - atomic memory write (when cache is not enabled) multicore safe: Yes - atomic memory write (when cache is not enabled) synchronous

simplesect.para: The testing method is described on TEST_LinInt_ScheduleTable_GetRequestedTable.

simplesect.title: Traceability
simplesect.para: Design Decision - Justification. Helper function to get the requested schedule table for a provided LIN interface.

briefdescription.para: This function will request the LIN bus sleep for a LIN interface.

briefdescription.para: This function will increment the diag counter for a LIN interface.

briefdescription.para: This function informs ErrHdl if it can set DTCs regarding the LIN communication.

detaileddescription.para: Switching to LIN flashing might cause timeouts in data frame reception.

briefdescription.para: Implementation file for LinSchedule.

detaileddescription.para: This module handles LIN schedule table switching.
